title.rendered: Financial Commission Publishes Article on Options Trading to Promote Trader Education

content.rendered:
April 17, 2019, The Financial Commission today announces the publication of a new educational article for traders in the Tips For All section of the organization’s official website. The article focuses on the inherent risks of trading binary options in the short-term and provides some analysis on how short term options trading works.

All interested traders can now access the article and find out how to avoid the pitfalls of short-term options trading from Dispute Resolution Committee members Demetrios Zamboglou and Roland Gemayel.

The Financial Commission regularly publishes tips for traders, as well as articles designed to educate traders on making informed decisions when trading or investing in the market. The organization hopes to provide a follow-up article on longer term binary options strategies in the coming weeks to further educate traders on this popular product class.

About Financial Commission

Founded in 2013, the Financial Commission is a leading independent member-driven external dispute resolution (EDR) organization for international online brokerages that participate in global foreign exchange (forex), derivatives, and CFD markets.

Financial Commission provides efficient compliance solutions to its members, alongside its External Dispute Resolution (EDR) mechanism that serves as an effective channel for processing complaints from clients of member firms.

To find out how the Commission is increasing traders education and market awareness, please visit the Traders section of our website.
